verb.description: Produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product)
examples: the land yields grapes and tobacco

verb.description: Give way to arguments, demands, or pressure.
examples: the Western powers now yielded when they should have resisted
he yielded to the demands of his partners

verb.description: (of a mass or structure) give way under force or pressure.
examples: he reeled into the house as the door yielded

noun.description: The full amount of an agricultural or industrial product.

origin: Old English g(i)eldan pay, repay, of Germanic origin. The senses produce, bear and surrender arose in Middle English.
